summary: 64 children died at the time of going to press 64, according to the country’s health ministry. many of the samples tested positive for enterovirus 71 (EV-71), which causes hand, foot and mouth disease. food standards The u.n. food standards body has agreed on a new set of regulations to protect the health of consumers across the world. other measures adopted include new food safety standards on seafood, melons, dried figs and food labelling. more than 250 million children were mildly to severely underweight in 2011. 17 countries – primarily in sub-Saharan Africa and Oceania – not showing any significant improvement. sharp declines in vaccine uptake in these two countries have led to a rise in the number of new infections between 2006 and 2011. the bivalent vaccine was comparable in effectiveness to the trivalent vaccine against type 1 poliovirus. the difference between the bivalent and trivalent vaccines was not statistically significant. in 2011, there were 198 cases in Pakistan and 80 cases in Afghanistan. in 2011, there were 198 cases in Pakistan and 80 cases in Afghanistan. in most parts of the world it has been eliminated by sustained vaccination programmes in the late 20th century. arian Day http://ochaonline.un.org/whd 10 September: World Suicide Prevention Day http://www.iasp.info/wspd 28 September: World Heart Day http://www.worldrabiesday.org 29 September: World Heart Day.
